taxon_identification.other_info_on_name: [Latin triquetrus, three edged, and -ella, diminutive, alluding to leaves commonly arranged in three rows]

bio:treatment.discussion: Triquetrella is distinctive in the stems rounded-triangular in section though this character is varies to rounded-pentagonal in the one species in the flora area. Although not fruiting in that area(and rarely so elsewhere in the world), the genus is unique in having both acrocarpous and pleurocarpous perichaetia on the same plant (R. H. Zander 1993). Unlike the similar Leptodontium, Triquetrella may occasionally show a small central strand (except, again, in the flora area).

references.reference: Stark, L. R. 1980. Triquetrella in North America. Bryologist 83: 363–364.
